title: Fiorina rejects idea of 'affirmative action' in CNN debate change
content:
poster= '' http : //v.███.com/images/1155968404/201509/2541/1155968404_4459439046001_4459401328001-vs.jpg ? pubId=1155968404 '' An excerpt of Carly Fiorina 's interview on Laura Ingraham 's radio show . Fiorina rejects idea of 'affirmative action ' in CNN debate change
Republican presidential candidate Carly Fiorina rejected the notion that CNN 's debate change amounted to `` affirmative action , '' saying on Wednesday that she has earned her place on the main stage of the second GOP debate on Sept. 16 .
`` I 've earned this place , '' Fiorina told Laura Ingraham on her radio show .
CNN changed its mind because `` the facts changed , '' the former Hewlett-Packard CEO remarked , a day after the network announced that it would allow any candidate that ranked in the top 10 between the last debate on Aug. 6 and Sept. 10 into the primetime debate . Previously , the CNN had planned to heavily weight surveys that had been done before the last debate . Fiorina has surged in the polls since her participation in the `` happy hour '' Fox News debate last month .
“ The point is , the thumb on the scale occurred because this year unlike previous presidential cycles , there were virtually no polls between Aug. 6 and Sept. 10 , '' she added .
In that span , there have been three polls thus far , with at least another two expected before the event .
Fiorina again blasted any suggestion that she was running as a means to be vice president . `` That 's sexist , '' she said .
“ I think I earned my place on the debate stage , I think I ’ ll earn the nomination and I think I ’ m qualified to do the job , '' she added , also saying `` I have never made gender an issue in this campaign . ''
The CNN debate on Sept. 16 , like last month 's Fox News debate , will be split into two sessions , with the lower-ranking candidates in the 17-strong field appearing at a much earlier event . The contenders in last month 's undercard debate have vigorously complained behind-the-scenes about perceptions of a `` loser debate . ''
Fiorina was a standout in the early debate last month and has since lobbied vigorously to be included in the main show , as her poll numbers have surged .
Appearing later on Ingraham 's show , New Jersey Gov . Chris Christie offered his take on the debate and whether it might mean he gets bumped out of the primetime event .
`` I do n't think you ever win a game by complaining with the umpires , '' Christie said . `` If it turns out that Carly 's upon the stage ... all it will mean is that there 's a little less time for everybody . ''
Asked if he was worried about missing the primetime stage , Christie was firm .
`` No , I 'll make the stage , '' Christie said , citing his understanding of CNN 's rules modification .
